newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent edges up, but lacks direction.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent edges up, but lacks direction.

text.p: June Brent crude futures were one cent higher on Tuesday after trading just four lots.
June was last traded on SIMEX at $18.28 per barrel compared with London's overnight settlement of $18.27.
Brokers said the market was struggling to find direction after London overnight settled unchanged on the day and New York fell a modest eight cents.
NYMEX June crude oil, trading on the ACCESS screen system, was last traded at $19.87 per barrel, down four cents from New York.
Technically, June Brent is at the top end of the recent trading range of the front-month position, which has ranged $17.50/$18.60.
The June position has created a chart gap between $18.64 and $18.77 per barrel, which brokers said needs to be filled to build confidence on the upside.
But some technical analysts said a bear flag could be forming, a view supported by momentum indicators showing a near overbought position.
